CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Application Submitted stage positioned above or below the Phone Screen stage?
SRP.A: The Application Submitted stage is positioned {above} the Phone Screen stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {linear} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Application Submitted?
VE.A: The value of stage Application Submitted is {100%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Phone Screen?
VE.A: The value of stage Phone Screen is {75%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Application Submitted, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Technical Interview, with a value of {25%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage HR Interview to stage Technical Interview?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage HR Interview to stage Technical Interview is {24%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Application Submitted to stage Phone Screen?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Application Submitted to stage Phone Screen is {25%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 62%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Application Submitted} stage has {100%}, the {Phone Screen} stage has {75%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 62%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {HR Interview} stage has {49%}, the {Technical Interview} stage has {25%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 37% and 87%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Phone Screen} stage has {75%}, the {HR Interview} stage has {49%}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage HR Interview to Technical Interview, or from stage Application Submitted to Phone Screen?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Application Submitted} to {Phone Screen} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage HR Interview to Technical Interview, or from stage Phone Screen to HR Interview?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Phone Screen} to {HR Interview} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Phone Screen to HR Interview, from stage Application Submitted to Phone Screen, or from stage HR Interview to Technical Interview?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Phone Screen} to stage {HR Interview} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Phone Screen} and {HR Interview} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {HR Interview} and {Technical Interview} stages.
